title: Implications of a Row of Zeros
text: When you encounter a matrix with an entire row of zeros, it typically suggests that the system has a dependent equation. This means that one of the equations doesn't provide any new information and can be derived from the other equations.

title: Conditions
text: The row of zeros could represent an equation like $$0=0$$, which doesn’t affect the system's consistency. In such cases, the system might still have one solution. However, if the system has a contradiction (ex: an equation like $$0=5)$$, the system would be inconsistent and have no solution.
